            Affiliation
            Associate Professor Center of Operations Research
            (CIO) Universidad Miguel Hernández de Elche Avda. de
            la Universidad s/n 3202 Elche (Alicante)– Spain
            Email: xbarber at umh point es
            
            
            CV Summary
            I am Dr. Xavier Barber, born in 1972 in Dénia, Spain. I
            earned my PhD in Statistics in 2009. As a statistician, I
            find immense fulfillment in applying statistical
            methodologies to real-world challenges. My routine work
            involves leveraging Bayesian statistics, and I am committed
            to employing spatio-temporal hierarchical techniques in
            ecological research, particularly in Species Distribution
            Modeling. Currently, my primary theoretical and practical
            focus is on quantifying uncertainty in this area of
            research. Additionally, in my role as the head of the joint
            research unit UMH-FISABIO, I concentrate on advanced
            statistical methods in the health sciences field.
            Allow me to briefly outline the most noteworthy
            accomplishments from my recent academic pursuits:
            I have authored over 100 publications, including
            articles in JCR journals, SCOPUS, dialnet, book chapters,
            and conference proceedings. Notably, I have developed or
            contributed to 59 articles in JCR journals. My research
            journey commenced with a ‘Formación de Personal Investigador
            (FPI)’ grant (1997-2005), initially tied to Public Health,
            resulting in my early publications in journals such as BMC
            Cancer, Journal of Epidemiology and Community Health,
            European Journal of Epidemiology, among others.
            Subsequently, my academic path led me to the Polytechnic
            School of Orihuela, where my research found its footing in
            Agronomy and Food Technology—an area in which I remain
            active today, spanning topics such as Food Quality, Food
            Chemistry, Crops and Industrial Products, Soil Science, and
            Plant Analysis.
            From 2020 to 2022, I was a part of ‘Valencia IA 4
            Covid,’ a taskforce working group led by Dr. Nuria Oliver,
            which provided counsel to the Regional Government utilizing
            Artificial Intelligence to combat Covid-19. Our group
            emerged as the victor of the worldwide Xprize ‘Pandemic
            Response Challenge,’ and I have contributed multiple
            publications on this subject.
            Within the realm of Bayesian Spatial Statistics, my
            work has been featured in journals such as Mathematics,
            JABES, SORT, and GeoSpatial Health. I have also presented
            over 30 papers at conferences (out of a total of 235),
            including several invited talks.
            I have participated in more than 20 projects
            (continuous funding since 2006) and research contracts,
            often in the role of principal investigator. I am a member
            of the National Network BIOSTATNET, and the excellence AIDS
            Research Network, CIBER-Infecciosas.
            Regarding knowledge transfer, I played a role in the
            establishment of the spin-off company Compostingreen S.L.
            and contributed to the development of significant
            statistical software, including one created for Eurostat,
            used for predicting agricultural production in the EU.
            Additionally, I have worked on the ‘eat:efficiency analysis
            trees’ R-package, a valuable tool.
            I earned the Best Poster Award at the International
            Workshop on Statistical Modelling 2010, where I presented a
            poster on my thesis titled ‘Geostatistical models for the
            study of bioclimatic indices.’ I have also received 3 UMH
            awards for Research Production.
            My teaching experience extends from 2004,
            encompassing both undergraduate and postgraduate levels.
            Since 2018, I have held the position of Associate Professor.
            I have been invited to teach in more than 20 postgraduate
            courses and subjects, as well as engage in various teaching
            activities across different institutions. In 2016 and 2022,
            I received the Teaching Talent Award, and in 2020.
            I have supervised 1 Ph.D. Thesis and I’m now
            supervising 3 more. also, I supervised 67 Master’s Theses
            (58 Master’s Degrees in Secondary Education and 9 research
            master’s degrees), 11 Final Theses, 1 Final Thesis Erasmus+,
            and 5 Final Degree Projects. Additionally, I have provided
            guidance to over 20 internship students.
            My commitment to continual improvement in teaching is
            evident through the publication of 11 teaching papers,
            involvement in 8 innovation projects (5 as the principal
            investigator), and the acquisition of the title of
            university expert in Technological Innovation in Education.
            I have also participated in more than 20 training courses
            and conferences. Consequently, I have transitioned from
            being a learner to being an educator, delivering training
            courses within the UMH-plan for teaching
            innovation.
            In the realm of university management, I served as
            Deputy Vice Rector for Research from 2011 to the present
            (2011-2015, 2015-2019, 2019-2023). Since 2015, I have held
            the position of President of the Animal Welfare Comission at
            UMH. I also serve as Secretary of the UMH Research
            Commission and as a Member of the Doctoral
            Commission.
            From 2014 to 2019, I held the role of
            Treasurer for the Spanish Society of Biostatistics
            (Spanish region of the International Biometric
            Society).
            I lead the Joint Research Unit for statistical
            methods in health sciences UMH-FISABIO, I am also a member
            of the ‘Valencia Bayesian Research Group’.

              Affiliation
              Associate Professor Center of Operations Research
              (CIO) Universidad Miguel Hernández de Elche Avda.
              de la Universidad s/n 3202 Elche (Alicante)– Spain
              Email: xbarber at umh point es
              
              
              CV Summary
              I am Dr. Xavier Barber, born in 1972 in Dénia, Spain. I
              earned my PhD in Statistics in 2009. As a statistician, I
              find immense fulfillment in applying statistical
              methodologies to real-world challenges. My routine work

              committed to employing spatio-temporal hierarchical
              techniques in ecological research, particularly in Species

              and practical focus is on quantifying uncertainty in this
              area of research. Additionally, in my role as the head of
              the joint research unit UMH-FISABIO, I concentrate on
              advanced statistical methods in the health sciences

              I have authored over 100 publications, including
              articles in JCR journals, SCOPUS, dialnet, book chapters,

              Quality, Food Chemistry, Crops and Industrial Products,
              Soil Science, and Plant Analysis.
              From 2020 to 2022, I was a part of ‘Valencia IA 4
              Covid,’ a taskforce working group led by Dr. Nuria Oliver,
              which provided counsel to the Regional Government
              utilizing Artificial Intelligence to combat Covid-19. Our
              group emerged as the victor of the worldwide Xprize
              ‘Pandemic Response Challenge,’ and I have contributed
              multiple publications on this subject.
              Within the realm of Bayesian Spatial Statistics, my
              work has been featured in journals such as Mathematics,
              JABES, SORT, and GeoSpatial Health. I have also presented
              over 30 papers at conferences (out of a total of 235),

              I have participated in more than 20 projects

              I earned the Best Poster Award at the International

              My teaching experience extends from 2004,
              encompassing both undergraduate and postgraduate levels.
              Since 2018, I have held the position of Associate
              Professor. I have been invited to teach in more than 20
              postgraduate courses and subjects, as well as engage in
              various teaching activities across different institutions.
              In 2016 and 2022, I received the Teaching Talent Award,
              and in 2020.
              I have supervised 1 Ph.D. Thesis and I’m now

              My commitment to continual improvement in teaching
              is evident through the publication of 11 teaching papers,
              involvement in 8 innovation projects (5 as the principal

              Education. I have also participated in more than 20
              training courses and conferences. Consequently, I have
              transitioned from being a learner to being an educator,
              delivering training courses within the UMH-plan for
              teaching innovation.
              In the realm of university management, I served as
              Deputy Vice Rector for Research from 2011 to the present
              (2011-2015, 2015-2019, 2019-2023). Since 2015, I have held
              the position of President of the Animal Welfare Comission
              at UMH. I also serve as Secretary of the UMH Research
              Commission and as a Member of the Doctoral

              From 2014 to 2019, I held the role of
              Treasurer for the Spanish Society of Biostatistics

articles.title: Xavi Barber's website
articles.description: Welcome to the website. I hope you enjoy it!
articles.contents:
Welcome to My Professional Story
Hello! Thanks for stopping by. I’m a dynamic and innovative statistician, starting my journey in the vibrant town of Dénia, Spain, back in 1972. Fast forward to the turn of the millennium, I graduated with a degree in Statistics and later achieved my PhD in 2009. My doctoral journey, “Geostatistical Models for Bioclimatic Indices,” was under the mentorship of the Professors Javier Morales and Antonio López-Quílez.
Since 2003, I have experienced significant professional growth at Miguel Hernández University, where I’ve been engaging minds as an Associate Professor of Statistics and Operations Research since 2018. This digital space is your gateway to my professional universe, showcasing my expertise, academic achievements, and thought leadership. Explore my latest research, scholarly publications, etc. Feel free to engage with my academic profile through platforms such as ORCID and Google Scholar
When not immersed in statistics, I recharge my batteries with the thrill of rowing and cycling. Whether it’s team spirit with my rowing crew or the camaraderie of cycling with my “grupetta,” The rebellious spirit of Motorhead’s rock anthems constantly fills me with energy..
Dive into the realm of my advanced statistical expertise, innovative research, and exhilarating hobbies. Delight in discovering my world.
Enjoy it!

            Bio
            Frank Hermosillo studies neural networks and their
            applications at Google Brain. His research focuses on
            differentiable network pruning approximation and
            decentralized gradient inversion mechanics. He frequently
            collaborates with researchers who study machine learning,
            computer vision, and cognitive science. His work has been
            featured in WIRED, The Atlantic, Newsweek, and The New York
            Times Magazine.
            
            
            Education
            Massachusetts Institute of Technology |
            Cambridge, MA
            Ph.D. in Computer Science | September 2009 - May 2014
            The University of California, Berkeley |
            Berkeley, CA
            B.S. in Computer Science | September 2005 - May 2009
            
            
            Experience
            Google Brain | Principal Investigator |
            January 2018 - Present
            Netflix | Research Scientist | June 2014
            - December 2017

            Research Groups
            Joint Research Unit STATSALUT: Advanced Statistical
            Methods in Health Sciences UMH-FISABIO (Principal
            Investigator)
            Valencia Bayesian Research Group (VABAR), based at
            the University of Valencia.
            Statistical Modeling Ecology Group (SMEG): An
            interdisciplinary research group that brings together
            researchers from the Schools of Mathematics and Statistics,
            Biology, and Ecology.
            
            
            Current Roles
            Statistical Editor at Public Health Nutrition.
            
            
            Scientific Associations
            Former Treasurer of the Spanish Region of the
            International Biometric Society (2014-2019).
            Meber of the Executive Board of the Spanish Region of
            the International Biometric Society (2014-2019,
            2021-)
            Member of the Representative Council of the
            International Biometric Society (2021-2025).
            
            
            University Management
            Deputy Vice-Rector for Research at Universidad Miguel
            Hernández, Spain (2011-2015, 2015-2019, 2019-2023).
            Deputy Director of the Institute of Mathematics, Data
            Science, and Artificial Intelligence at Universidad Miguel
            Hernández, Spain (2023-2028).
